content.description: Start on two Gastons and lieback the undercling rail and finish slightly to the right up the "groove". Really bad smears! A bit mossed over now...

Start on shallow pockets. Get the feet up a bit and then gun it for the large pockets in the middle. Get into a stance and go for more smaller pockets up and to the right. A little further to the ledge and then top out.
content.location: If you enter from the trail, walk to the other side of the boulder, then head right. Its in the middle of the boulder where you see the pockets

content.description: A great climb up for the new boulderer or climb down for the experienced. Go up the easy steps and onto a ramp to head up
content.location: If you enter from the trail, walk to the other side of the boulder, and its on the corner before you head right

content.description: Grade is a total guess. Could be 9z+ for all I know. Obvious squeeze line on the left side of the main slightly overhung face on the rome boulder.
content.protection: A few pads but not even necessary.

content.location: From the main trail, you will be facing the side of the boulder that features The Scrmable

content.description: Start on the hairline seam on the right side of the face, on the bulge. Head your way up and leftwards along the seam
content.location: If you enter from the trail, walk to the other side of the boulder, then head right. It's just to the right around the corner

content.description: Start on good pockets and smears. Shallow pockets are to the right. Get to the good left-facing sidepull with the left hand and you can lunge to the lip to finish
content.location: If you are walking in from the main trail, you'll see the downclimb route on the boulder. There is another downclimb to the right of that first one. This route is just to the right of that

content.description: Start the same as the architect but finish direct and slightly to the left. A bit easier but more dynamic and powerful!
Start on pocket right hand and left blocky left pinch, and squeeze your way up!
content.location: The obvious prow/ Arete. The first line you see hiking up.

content.description:
Start in the finger crack and smears. Continue to work the thin finger crack until it widens, allowing you to move your stance. You can use the wider spots until some shallow pockets become available near the top. Finish up and over to the left where the crack ends

A variation exists. Just past the upper portion of the wide crack, you'll see a 3 inch wide pocket ledge. Utilize that to finish to the right instead of continuing left along the crack. Same grade
content.location: If you enter from the trail, walk to the other side of the boulder, then head right. You'll see the prominent crack down the middle of the boulder

content.description: Start on the hairline seam on the right side of the face, on the bulge. Head up halfway and then head right along the water groove instead of right along the seam
content.location: If you enter from the trail, walk to the other side of the boulder, then head right. It's just to the right around the corner

content.description: Crux is the open move to get into a sloped stance within a shallow spot in the rock. Once in a good stance reach up right for the right-facing sidepull and then bump it up to the good juggy ledge
content.location: If you enter from the trail, walk to the other side of the boulder, then head right. Its at the corner

content.description: Crux is the open move to get into a sloped stance within a shallow spot in the rock. Once in a good stance reach up with the left hand to a juggy ledge
content.location: If you enter from the trail, walk to the other side of the boulder, then head right. Its at the corner

content.description: Start on awkward smears and shallow pockets. Work your way up on some better pockets until you can lunge to the upper lip
content.location: If you are walking in from the main trail, you'll see the downclimb route on the boulder. This is just to the right

content.description: Starts on the crack. Balance over the bulge. From there look for a pocket high to the right so you can get into a stance. Finish up the hairline crack to the left
content.location: If you enter from the trail, walk to the other side of the boulder, then head right. Look for the bulge just right of the middle of the boulder

content.description: Starts crouched on opposing sidepulls located between B is for Brutus and Gladius. Crux is the huge move off a thin pinch to the crimp above.
content.location: Roman Boulder, to the left of Gladius and to the right of B is for Brutus.

content.description:
Start on two sloping crimps in the middle of the face and do one hard move through a sloper to top out.

Low start (also FA Sam Anglin) starts on the undercling down and left and goes at V10/11.
content.location: Left of Gladius and Caesar Salad, on the two crimps in the middle of the face.
